title: Souvenir
description: Travellers and tourists don't have a digital showcase to show off the places they visited. There no such trusted global platform exists

f6_assessments.q0:
I like the idea but the proposal seems more like just an idea rather than a proposal. 
It seems rushed. Nonetheless the idea is good and could become something in the future. It's kind of like Pokemon Go or Geocaching, but with NFTs.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no plan. There is no way to determine the proposer's experience as there is no additional information given. There is also no explanation as to how it could get implemented. 
Therefore it can't be deemed feasible to succeed.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal needs a lot more information to define the likeliness of success. 
It needs a detailed plan, some kind of justification for the requested funding, a roadmap, a risk assessment, links to web pages with additional information, maybe an infographic to illustrate what is intended to be created, metrics of success, how it would survive after funding (ROI), how it could reach people.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has a good idea, but little to no info as to how the product will work exactly. It would help to see some prototypes or just know how the product will connect to other products or if its a stand alone product. These points can make a huge difference in how the product will be adopted and how it will grow.
f6_assessments.q1: Not enough info to support and showcase the experience of the team involved. No budget allocation or plan behind the budget. Providing links to github pages or linkedIn or any link to projects you've actually worked on would boost voter and CA confidence. Creating prototypes of how the product would look and function would also give a boost to this proposal's validity.
f6_assessments.q2:
No info provided to track the success of this project.
The idea behind the project can definitely work with the right team and the right plan. No solution to creating this product is provided and no risks or challenges have been considered.

f6_assessments.q0: this is a good idea and suitable for the task. for a successful proposal, more details should be mentioned so that it is more than just an idea. for example, you could show a few pictures of an app (prototype) and also explain how the functions are integrated.
f6_assessments.q1: the existing experience can't be checked because there are no links or references. unfortunately, the given website doesn't show me any information about a product either. the link to the website should lead to a meaningful appearance and should be rounded off with e.g. linked.in profiles. a team is mentioned here and should be noted in the next proposal with all the details mentioned above so that you can understand which people are behind the project. the requested funds of $5000 should be broken down to subsections and explained.
f6_assessments.q2: a timeline and milestones are not described, but are necessary to understand when and how the project can be successfully completed. consequential costs and risks should also be mentioned. in summary, the progress of this proposal is very difficult to assess.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is presenting an attractive idea, creating a platform where travelers can earn place-unique NFTs by visiting parts and sights of the world, as a digital souvenir. There is not a lot information described, apart from the core concept. And it would benefit the proposal if the problem solution included for example: Is the solution creating the app or platform, or is it to implement this concept on another platform? Will the platform provide the NFTs, and does the project entail cooperating with the tourist industry? The core idea is there, but in order to assess if the proposal matches the challenge brief, a little bit more information is needed. At the moment, it is difficult to say due to the lack of information.
f6_assessments.q1:
Assuming that there is no team, but a single developer (it is unclear in the proposal) for this project, there's a lot of experience in IT and mobile app development which is good. The proposer is referring to a team of creators but they are not listed in the proposal apart from a reference to a website. I would like to learn more about the expertise of the developer(s) via for example a LinkedIn profile, or a list of what kind of work the developer has done, in order to increase the credibility of the proposal. 
As stated before, the idea for the project is there, but it is difficult to assess the success and possibility of success for the project if there's no details regarding HOW the project will be developed. What milestones does the team want to achieve and during what timeframe? How will the budget be allocated amongst the team, and how many hours is expected to take until the product is finished? Currently, none of this information is in the proposal which make it very difficult to assess the feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: In order for this proposal to be auditable, it would have to include a roadmap with short and long term goals for the developing team (preferably with a time frame included). There are no measurements of success that the community can follow during the process, for example 'how many downloads of the app at this point' etc. It would also be beneficial for the project to include some knowledge of the risks and challenges from the development team, and how they plan to address these. Currently, there is no form of auditability within this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: I am giving 2 stars because I cannot relate how will a travel souvenirs NFT will address the challenge. How will this project be any different from art NFT. Does it have any utility or use cases such as cheap hotel accommodation or flight ticket discount ? If there is so, please provide the details.  The proposer also did not explain on how this project will add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team did not provide the relevant verifiable information about the team members, manpower allocation, budget breakdown and proper roadmap. There is a high chance that this project will not be implemented. Therefore I am giving 1 star
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer did not provide timeline and roadmap for the project. There is no transparency on where they will report on the progress of the work. I strongly disagree with this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess impact. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess feasibility. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Draft proposal. There is not enough information to assess auditability. I would recommend checking the Catalyst documentation for reference to create a new proposal and search for an appropriate challenge to submit the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very vague and does not address the challenge to an acceptable standard even though this idea is a great one which would be adopted by travelers if a good idea was implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no confirmation to back the proposers claims. This does not give assessors confidence especially when considering the vague proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer offers a cost figure but does not offer a roadmap or cost outline for how these funds will be spent. This does not give assessors confidence that there will be auditability with the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does bring up a use case in which a business could leverage NFTs on cardano, but this proposal does not present a plan for how to gain adoption from businesses or how to bring this to market.
f6_assessments.q1: Their team has years of experience in IT and mobile development, but they do not back up that experience with any supporting material or noted accomplishments. They do not lay out a plan to success,  so I can no confidently say this will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal does not provide any information on key metrics of success, or any milestones to gauge the success and progress. The audit would not be sufficient with the given info.

f6_assessments.q0: Only a vague NFT use case is presented, not a legitimate business model.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer notes relevant experience but the proposal lacks many essential details.  Given the state of the proposal I would rate it highly unlikely to be executed successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: no specific milestones, timelines, or budgets are given.

solution: Digital Souvenir provides a digital ownership for travellers as NFTs. Travellers can collect the souvenirs as in pokermon go game
experience: 17 years of IT experience with 10+ in mobile app development,  a good team of creators in our 99products.in team who has good track record
